title: Big brush fire breaks out in Northeast Washington
text:
A large brush fire broke out Friday night in Northeast Washington, amid abnormally dry conditions in the metropolitan area.

The fire was reported just east of N. Capitol Street, between Catholic University and the Soldiers and Airmen’s Home.

The D.C. fire department described the blaze as a “very large brush fire.” In a tweet, the department said a brush unit was requested from the Montgomery County Fire Department.

Conditions in Washington have been unusually dry, with only .11 inches of rain reported by the National Weather Service in Washington.

description: Blaze near N. Capitol Street, Catholic University, according to fire department.
